intro: Daiswa polyphylla, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, arranged in a rosette, and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Daiswa polyphylla produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
